profile.profileDescription: Profile created on June 2 2021 at 16:49:16 by Ingo Seidel

label.name: Types de libellés pour les éléments de liste
Défini les types de statut pour les items primaires
Ställ in postens primära status typer

label.description: Item in EFG is purely designed for dealing with aggregation of files, CEN’s Item definition can accomodate physical( film) material as well as files. It is therefore preferred to use the CEN definition over EFGs, in order to be able to depict analog audiovisual items too. EFG has a completely different Item than CEN, with no common fields (except for an identifier, but under different names). In order to keep the VHH-EFG schema consistent, CEN-Item fields will be renamed to EFG terms where it makes sense.

label.name: Valeurs de type de libellés pour les lots d'objets
Valeurs de type de libellé de prêt

label.description: Undefined place type. Can be used to create places where the type is unknown or to be defined later.

label.name: Valeurs de type libellés de lieux

label.description: A public screening or broadcast, or a public release on a physical distributionmedium or online.
A decision about the suitability of a cinematographic work or variant for a particularaudience. Includes censorship and rating decisions.
An event that has relevant historical influence.
A bestowal of an award relating to the cinematographic work or to a specific achievement byan Agent in the context of a cinematographic work.
A specific event in the creation of the cinematographic work.
The creation of a new manifestation or variant with the intent of safeguarding the contents of a cinematographic work.

label.name: Valeurs de types de libellé d'emplacements de stockage

label.description: https://www.loc.gov/standards/iso639-2/php/langcodes_name.php?code_ID=495
Unspecified date type.
Terms used for Agent type "Group" or "Organization"
The date, month, or year when the Corporate Body or Group was founded.

A year from which a film-related activity of the Corporate Body was known. Multiple values with this attribute value typically delinate the floruit period, in the case the first and last year for which there is evidence of a film-related activity.
The date, month or year when the Corporate Body or Group was dissolved.
Terms to be used for Places.
A comma-separated text of related keywords.
Content that is contained in another content. A component part may itself be either monographic or serial.
Complete content in one part or intended to be completed in a finite number of parts.
Content issued in successive parts and intended to be continued indefinitely.
A numeric index used for merely indicating a sort order of parts.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Academy_ratio
Any film or other carrier which translates the colour values of the visible world into grayscale (black, white, and shades of gray)
Any film or other carrier which reproduces the color values of the visible world, whether by chemical, optical or mechanical means.
The carrier is mostly in colour but has a few b/w parts.
Either another colour type as indicated in this list or unknown.
WAVE (RIFF) https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc2361

This Rights Statement can be used for an Item that is in copyright. Using this statement implies that the organization making this Item available has determined that the Item is in copyright and either is the rights-holder, has obtained permission from the rights-holder(s) to make their Work(s) available, or makes the Item available under an exception or limitation to copyright (including Fair Use) that entitles it to make the Item available. URI: http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/InC/1.0/

This Rights Statement is intended for use with Items for which the underlying Work has been identified as an Orphan Work in accordance with Directive 2012/28/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 25 October 2012 on certain permitted uses of Orphan Works. It can only be applied to Items derived from Works that are covered by the Directive: Works published in the form of books, journals, newspapers, magazines or other writings as well as cinematographic or audiovisual works and phonograms (note: this excludes photography and visual arts). It can only be applied by organizations that are beneficiaries of the Directive: publicly accessible libraries, educational establishments and museums, archives, film or audio heritage institutions and public-service broadcasting organizations, established in one of the EU member states. The beneficiary is also expected to have registered the work in the EU Orphan Works Database maintained by EUIPO. URI: http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/InC-OW-EU/1.0/

This Rights Statement can be used only for copyrighted Items for which the organization making the Item available is the rights-holder or has been explicitly authorized by the rights-holder(s) to allow third parties to use their Work(s) for educational purposes without first obtaining permission. URI: http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/InC-EDU/1.0/

This Rights Statement can be used only for copyrighted Items for which the organization making the Item available is the rights-holder or has been explicitly authorized by the rights-holder(s) to allow third parties to use their Work(s) for non-commercial purposes without obtaining permission first. URI: http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/InC-NC/1.0/

This Rights Statement is intended for use with an Item that has been identified as in copyright but for which no rights-holder(s) has been identified or located after some reasonable investigation. This Rights Statement should only be used if the organization that intends to make the Item available is reasonably sure that the underlying Work is in copyright. This Rights Statement is not intended for use by EU-based organizations who have identified works as Orphan Works in accordance with the EU Orphan Works Directive (they must use InC-OW-EU instead). URI: http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/InC-RUU/1.0/

The following four rights statements are intended for works that are not in copyright but where there are restrictions other than copyright that prevent free re-use or where the out of copyright status has only been ascertained for a specific jurisdiction. These rights statements should only be used when it is not possible to use the Public Domain Mark or the CC0 Public Domain Dedication.

This Rights Statement can only be used for Items that are in the Public Domain but for which the organization that intends to make the Item available has entered into contractual agreement that requires it to take steps to restrict third party uses of the Item. In order for this Rights Statement to be conclusive, the organization that intends to make the Item available should provide a link to a page detailing the contractual restrictions that apply to the use of the Item. URI: http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/NoC-CR/1.0/

This Rights Statement can only be used for Works that are in the Public Domain and have been digitized in a public-private partnership as part of which, the partners have agreed to limit commercial uses of this digital representation of the Work by third parties. It has been developed specifically to allow the inclusion of Works that have been digitized as part of the partnerships between European Libraries and Google, but can in theory be applied to Items that have been digitized in similar public-private partnerships. URI: http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/NoC-NC/1.0/

This Rights Statement should be used for Items that are in the Public Domain but that cannot be freely re-used as the consequence of known legal restrictions that prevent the organization that intends to make the Item available from allowing free re-use of the Item, such as cultural heritage or traditional cultural expression protections. In order for this Rights Statement to be conclusive, the organization that intends to make the Item available should provide a link to a page detailing the legal restrictions that limit re-use of the Item. URI: http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/NoC-OKLR/1.0/

This Rights Statement should be used for Items for which the organization that intends to make the Item available has determined are free of copyright under the laws of the United States. This Rights Statement should not be used for Orphan Works (which are assumed to be in-copyright) or for Items where the organization that intends to make the Item available has not undertaken an effort to ascertain the copyright status of the underlying Work. URI: http://rightsstatements.org/vocab/NoC-US/1.0/

The following three rights statements are intended for use with digital objects where the copyright status has not been determined with certainty. These should only be used if it is not possible to use a clearer rights statement or license.
Use this, if the concrete type of control an entity had over this object is not known.

This is the name shall be used when a reference to the corporate body is visualised in the EFG web portal.

The official name in case the preferred name is a pseudonym, or the full form of the name as used in official documents. Also used for names in the native script if the preferred name is in transliteraded form.
An incorrect spelling of the name found in important sources.
Any other name by which the corporate body is or has been known. May include forms with titles or other name parts not regularly used.
Abbrevation of the corporate body´s name.
Regular 8, Standard 8, 8mm (before 1965)
Super 8, Single 8
used for: Normal 16 / Super 16
used for: 35 mm silent film, 35 mm-Academy, 35 mm (1,66), 35 mm (1,85), CinemaScope, Super 35, Techniscope, Maxivision, Vistavision, Technirama, Cinerama, Cinemiracle
used for: Panavision Super 70, Todd-AO, Ultra Panavision 70 (MGM Camera 65), Showscan, IMAX, IMAX HD
used for: DEFA 70, MCS 70, Super panorama, Super panavision
The date, month, or year when the Group was founded.

A year from which a film-related activity of the Group was known. Multiple values with this attribute value typically delinate the floruit period, in the case the first and last year for which there is evidence of a film-related activity
The date, month or year when the Group was dissolved.
The Person´s birth place as indicated in the source record.
The Person´s place of death as indicated in the source record.

label.description: Narrative description for item in this set. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the item in the context of this set.

label.name: Description de l'objet
label.description: Description narrative pour un élément de cet ensemble. Il s'agit du texte principal utilisé lors d'un affichage public d'un élément dans le contexte de cet ensemble.

label.name: Post beskrivning
label.description: Berättande beskrivning för poster i denna gruppering. Detta är den primära texten som används när poster i grupperingen visas offentligt.

label.name: Presentation type
label.description: Determines how set is rendered when displayed to the public in the Pawtucket/Pawtucket2 front-end.

label.name: Presentation type
label.description: Determines how set is rendered when displayed to the public in the Pawtucket/Pawtucket2 front-end.

label.name: Type de présentation
label.description: Détermine comment l'ensemble est affiché dans le catalogue public Pawtucket/Pawtucket2.

label.name: Presentation typ
label.description: Bestämmer hur gruppering återges när den visas för allmänheten i Pawtucket/Pawtucket2 front-end.

label.name: Is primary item for set?
label.description: The item marked as primary will be used to represent the set as a whole when included in a list of sets.

label.name: Is primary item for set?
label.description: The item marked as primary will be used to represent the set as a whole when included in a list of sets.

label.name: Est l'item principal de l'ensemble ?
label.description: L'item marqué comme principal sera utilisé pour représenter l'ensemble comme un tout dans l'affichage d'une liste d'ensembles.

label.name: Är det primära objektet för gruppering?
label.description: Objekt markerad som primär kommer att användas för att representera grupperingen i sin helhet när det ingår i en lista över grupperingar.

label.name: Chronology element code
label.description: Element code of date range element to be used when placing set items into chronological order.

label.name: Chronology element code
label.description: Element code of date range element to be used when placing set items into chronological order.

label.name: Code de période
label.description: Code d'une plage de dates à utiliser lorsque les items sont affichés en ordre chronologique.

label.name: Kronologi elementkod
label.description: Elementkoden för datumintervall element som användas för att placera in föremål i kronologisk ordning.

label.name: Authorization date
label.description: The date when the loan was authorized.

label.name: Authorization date
label.description: The date when the loan was authorized.

label.name: Date d'autorisation
label.description: La date à laquelle le prêt a été autorisé.

label.name: Datum för godkännande
label.description: Det datum då lånet beviljades.

label.name: Loan in date
label.description: The date a loan will enter the institution.

label.name: Loan in date
label.description: The date a loan will enter the institution.

label.name: Prêt planifié
label.description: La date où un prêt rejoindra l'institution.

label.name: Inlåningsdatum
label.description: Datumet ett lån kommer till institutionen.

label.name: Loan out date
label.description: The date a loan will enter the institution.

label.name: Loan out date
label.description: The date a loan will enter the institution.

label.name: Date de prêt
label.description: La date à laquelle un prêt entrera dans l'institution.

label.name: Utlåningsdatum
label.description: Datumet ett lån kommer till institutionen.

label.name: Loan return date
label.description: The date a loan is due back to the lending institution.

label.name: Loan return date
label.description: The date a loan is due back to the lending institution.

label.name: Date de retour de prêt
label.description: La date à laquelle le prêt doit être retourné à l'institution prêtante.

label.name: Lån återlämningsdatum
label.description: Datumet ett lån kommer tillbaka till det långivande institutet.

label.name: Loan renewal application date
label.description: The date to apply for a renewal to the loan.

label.name: Loan renewal application date
label.description: The date to apply for a renewal to the loan.

label.name: Date du renouvellement de prêt
label.description: La date de réalisation du renouvellement du prêt.

label.name: Lån förnyelse ansökningsdag
label.description: Datumet att ansöka om förnyelse för lånet.

label.name: Loan conditions
label.description: A statement of the conditions on a loan.

label.name: Loan conditions
label.description: A statement of the conditions on a loan.

label.name: Conditions de prêt
label.description: Un rappel des conditions du prêt.

label.name: Lånevillkor
label.description: En redogörelse för villkoren på ett lån.

label.name: Loan note
label.description: General information about the loan.

label.name: Loan note
label.description: General information about the loan.

label.name: Note sur le prêt
label.description: Informations générales sur le prêt.

label.name: Lån anteckning
label.description: Allmän information om lånet.

label.name: Loan purpose
label.description: General information about the purpose of loan.

label.name: Loan purpose
label.description: General information about the purpose of loan.

label.name: Proposition de prêt
label.description: Information générale sur la proposition de prêt.

label.name: Lån syfte
label.description: Allmän information om syftet med lånet.

label.name: Movement method
label.description: The method used in the movement of an object.

label.name: Movement method
label.description: The method used in the movement of an object.

label.name: Méthode de mouvement
label.description: La méthode utilisée pour le mouvement d'un objet.

label.name: Förflyttningsmetod
label.description: Den metod som används i förflyttningen av ett objekt.

label.name: Movement note
label.description: Additional information about the movement of an object or group of objects.

label.name: Movement note
label.description: Additional information about the movement of an object or group of objects.

label.name: Note de mouvement
label.description: Informations additionnelles à propos du mouvement de l'objet ou d'un groupe d'objets.

label.name: Förflyttning anteckning
label.description: Ytterligare information om förflyttning av ett objekt eller en grupp av objekt.

label.name: Planned removal date
label.description: The date an object is to be removed from its current location.

label.name: Planned removal date
label.description: The date an object is to be removed from its current location.

label.name: Date de retrait prévu
label.description: La date où l'objet doit être retiré de sa localisation actuelle.

label.name: Planerad borttagningsdatum
label.description: Datumet ett objekt ska tas bort från sin nuvarande plats.

label.name: Planned removal date
label.description: The date an object was actually removed from its current location.

label.name: Planned removal date
label.description: The date an object was actually removed from its current location.

label.name: Plage de retrait prévu
label.description: Les dates auxquelles l'objet a été actuellement retiré de sa localisation actuelle.

label.name: Planerat borttagningsdatum
label.description: Datumet ett föremål faktiskt togs bort från dess nuvarande plats.

label.name: Reason for move
label.description: The purpose or reason for the movement of the object or group of objects.

label.name: Reason for move
label.description: The purpose or reason for the movement of the object or group of objects.

label.name: Raison du mouvement
label.description: Le motif ou la raison du mouvement de l'objet ou du groupe d'objets.

label.name: Orsak till flytt
label.description: Syftet eller skäl för förflyttning av objekt eller en grupp av objekt.

label.name: Introduction
label.description: Narrative description for tour. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the tour.

label.name: Introduction
label.description: Narrative description for tour. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the tour.

label.name: Introduction
label.description: Narrative description for tour. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the tour.

label.name: Inledning
label.description: Berättande beskrivning av turen. Detta är den primära texten som används när turen presenteras.

label.name: Introduction
label.description: Narrative description for tour stop. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the stop.

label.name: Introduction
label.description: Narrative description for tour stop. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the stop.

label.name: Introduction
label.description: Narrative description for tour stop. This is the primary text used when publicly presenting the stop.

label.name: Inledning
label.description: Berättande beskrivning av turen. Detta är den primära texten som används när turen presenteras.

label.name: Georeference
label.description: Location of this stop.

label.name: Georeference
label.description: Location of this stop.

label.name: Georeference
label.description: Location of this stop.

label.name: Georeferens
label.description: Plats för detta stopp.

label.name: Description
label.description: An account of the resource. Description may include but is not limited to: an abstract, a table of contents, a graphical representation, or a free-text account of the resource.

label.name: Source of description
label.description: Source of item description. This should be a formal citation if possible. For informal sources a narrative description is acceptable.

label.name: Notes (internal use only)
label.description: Notes regarding item

label.name: Georeference
label.description: Coordinates documenting the location of the item

label.name: Coverage Notes
label.description: The spatial or temporal topic of the resource, the spatial applicability of the resource, or the jurisdiction under which the resource is relevant. Spatial topic and spatial applicability may be a named place or a location specified by its geographic coordinates. Temporal topic may be a named period, date, or date range. A jurisdiction may be a named administrative entity or a geographic place to which the resource applies. Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary such as the Thesaurus of Geographic Names [TGN]. Where appropriate, named places or time periods can be used in preference to numeric identifiers such as sets of coordinates or date ranges.

label.name: Format Notes
label.description: Further notes on the file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource.

label.name: Library of Congress Subject Headings
label.description: Library of Congress Subject headings describing this object. To add a new heading simply type the first few letters of the heading and choose the desired one from the displayed list of possible matches.

label.name: Rights
label.description: Information about rights held in and over the resource.

label.name: Rights Holder
label.description: To identify the person or organisation holding or managing the rights related to the resource.

label.name: Copyright Statement
label.description: Use to state copyright statements over the resource.

label.name: Description
label.description: Narrative biography for entity. This is the primary text used to document the entity.

label.name: Source of description
label.description: Source of entity biography. This should be a formal citation if possible. For informal sources a narrative description is acceptable.

label.name: Language
label.description: The language or languages of the spoken, sung or written content of the variant or manifestation of a cinematographic work.

label.name: Name
label.description: The language or languages of the spoken, sung or written content of the variant or manifestation of a cinematographic work.

label.name: Usage
label.description: This attribute may be used to indicate in what form the language occurs in the manifestation (e.g. dialogue, song text, intertitles, narrator, voice-over, on-camera voice, etc.). If omitted, the language is assumed to be the primary language of the variant or manifestation.

label.name: Event Date
label.description: The date on which the event happened, or the action took place that this event describes, as defined by each event type in EFG/CEN.

label.name: External Identifier
label.description: An unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context, where possible the International Standard Audio-visual Number (ISAN), otherwise a specific number issued by a government department or other official body in an individual country, or an archive’s inventory number.

label.name: Scheme
label.description: An unambiguous reference of the scope within which the identifier is unique. References may take the form of an internationally known identification scheme, an XML namespace identifier (e.g. http://deutsches-filminstitut.de/zfdb/id), or a URN namespace (e.g. URN:UUID or URN:ISAN).

label.name: Value
label.description: The value of the identifier excluding any references to an identifier scheme.

label.name: Description Level
label.description: A one-character symbol indicating the role of the cinematographic work within part-whole relationships.

label.name: Title
label.description: Titles can occur on several levels of description and can change during the lifecycle of a creation. Titles can be a word, phrase or character, naming the work or a group of works, a particular manifestation or an individual item.

label.name: Language
label.description: The language of the title. (If no value is available in the source archive, the value must be set to "undetermined".)

label.name: Title Text
label.description: The textual expression of the title.

label.name: Part designation
label.description: A combination of the name of a structuring unit and the count value that identifies the current work as an individual part of a complex work. For complex works with multi-level numberings (e.g. "season 3, episode 12"), an instance of this element should be created for each level. Non-numeric values such as letter symbols (e.g. "part B") or calendar dates (e.g. "August 1965 issue") are permitted.

label.name: Part Unit
label.description: The name of the unit that this work represents within a series, serial, or multi-part work (e.g. "part", "episode", "issue", etc).

label.name: Part Value
label.description: An ordinal number, numeration symbol, or date value that identifies the individual work within the complex work.

label.name: Part Title
label.description: Used to describe individual parts that would not warrant its own creation/manifestation due to lack of significantly important differences in properties.

label.name: Title Type
label.description: Describes the relationship between the title and the entity to which it is assigned. Examples include "original title", "working title", "distribution title", "translation", etc.

label.name: Geographic Scope (Place)
label.description: For entities that are or have been distributed under different titles in distinct geographical regions, this element should indicate to which region(s) the title applies.

label.name: Geographic Scope (Freetext)
label.description: This field is just a fallback option, in case it is not possible or desired to link to a vocabulary term. For example: To preserve information imported from 3rd party sources that cannot be mapped exactly.

label.name: Remarks
label.description: Optional remarks about anything that may seem relevant to be associated with this title.

label.name: Note
label.description: This element includes all data that cannot fit into other elements. Use wisely! ;)

label.name: Text
label.description: This element includes all data that cannot fit into other elements. Use wisely! ;)

label.name: Reference
label.description:
This field is to categorize the notes in some way. For example to relate the notes to fields in the schema, use reference="field:FIELD_NAME". This allows to make remarks to any field in a standardized way.
If the notes do not relate to data in a certain schema field, than reference=“general remarks“

label.name: Country of Reference
label.description: An element used for describing the geographic origin of a cinematographic work. Wherever known and applicable, this should be the country or countries where the production facilities are located. Multinational productions will typically have more than one country of reference, including those with Agents that were not directly involved in the creation of the cinematographic work (e.g. entities that have contributed financial resources). If production information is missing, this element may refer to countries where the cinematographic work was filmed or distributed, or where copies are known to exist in archives.

label.name: Country
label.description: Refers to a Place entry. Using this field is preferred over the freetext option.

label.name: Reference
label.description: The relationship between the country or geographic area and the cinematographic work. Defaults to "production", i.e. use of this attribute is only required if the geographic location is different from the country of production.

label.name: Freetext (Source)
label.description:
Exact quote from ValueSource.
This field is just a fallback option, in case it is not possible or desired to link to a vocabulary term. For example: To preserve information imported from 3rd party sources that cannot be mapped exactly.

label.name: Digital Format (AV)
label.description: The format of the digital AV file.

label.name: Coding (Image)
label.description: Specifies the codification of the data (e.g. “WMA”,”WMV”, “MPEG-4”, “RealVideo”).

label.name: Coding (Audio)
label.description: Specifies the codification of audio data (e.g. „PCM (uncompressed)“, „MPEG-4 AAC“, „FLAC“, etc). If there are more than 1 tracks of the same type, only the primary/default track is to be depicted here.

label.name: MIME Type
label.description: The digital format of the manifestation (RFC 2049 MIME types, e.g. „audio/wav”, „video/mp4”, „image/dpx“, etc.).

label.name: Gauge
label.description: The width of the film stock or other carrier (such as magnetic tape) used for the manifestation. Should include value and unit (e.g. "35 mm", "1/2 inch" etc).

label.name: Aspect Ratio
label.description: The ratio between width and height of the image (e.g. "full frame", "cinemascope", "1:1,33").

label.name: Sound
label.description: This field is intended for containing information about the film source sound. It shall not be used to store technical metadata of how the audiovisual file is encoded, as this shall be stored in „DigitalFormat“.

label.name: System
label.description: The name of the system by which sound is recorded either on the carrier, on a separate medium, or as part of the digital encoding (e.g. Western Electric (Westrex), Movietone, RCA Photophone, Tobis, Dolby Digital, etc.).

label.name: Method
label.description: A name of the physical principle of sound recording (Needle sound, optical sound, magnetic sound, analog or digital).

label.name: Freetext (Source)
label.description: Exact quote from ValueSource

label.name: Provenance
label.description: Information about the chronology of ownership or custody of the manifestation. As soon as a definite „Agent“ entity is known, using the field „ControllingEntity“ shall be preferred.

label.name: Language
label.description: The language of the major verbal content of the document.

label.name: Date
label.description:
A point or period of time associated with the entry. Syntax for input is ISO8601:
  • Exact date: yyyy-mm-dd
  • Period: "date - date"
  • From: "date -"
  • Until: "- date"

label.name: Date
label.description: A point or period of time associated with the lifecycle.

label.name: Type
label.description: This attribute specifies the type of temporal properties (e.g. issued, digitised).

label.name: Digital Format (NonAV)
label.description: The digital format of the manifestation

label.name: MIME Type
label.description: The digital format of the manifestation (RFC 2049 MIME types, e.g. “image/jpg”, ”text/plain” etc.).

label.name: Pixel Resolution
label.description: The degree of sharpness of the digital object expressed in pixel: "width x height". This is the resolution of pixels actually stored in the media file.

label.name: Extent
label.description: The total physical dimension of the manifestation represented as numeric value, with decimal places if required. For example, if the carrier type is a DVD, it represents the DVD size. If the carrier type is a file, it represents the size in bytes, etc.

label.name: Value
label.description:
The total physical or logical extent of the manifestation or of the item from a manifestation. Physical extent is the total length of the medium carrying the manifestation or item.
Logical extent is the number of discrete units, e.g. image frames, bytes (octets), etc., of which the manifestation or item is composed.

label.name: Unit
label.description: Unit of the physical dimension of the manifestation (e.g. “bytes”, “meters”, “inches”).

label.name: Reference
label.description: If the manifestation is composed of more than one physical carrier for which individual lengths are known, then this attribute should be used to refer the length information to a particular carrier (e.g. “reel 3”).

label.name: Frame Rate
label.description: Optional value for the projection speed, given in frames per second, to which the given duration refers. Rational numbers (29.97) shall be used instead of fractions (30000/1001) to facilitate using this number to calculate the duration. The reduction in precision due to that is considered acceptable, considered the expected maximum duration of a recording. If possible, then it should be read from an existing media file. If in contradiction, this value shall funcation as manual override of the framerate in the media file.

label.name: FPS
label.description: The actual framerate value in Frames per Second (fps).

label.name: Reference
label.description: Use this field to declare further reference information about the framerate, if necessary.

label.name: Controlling Entity
label.description: ControllingEntity is intended to keep track of legal information. It replaces the following EFG fields: RightsHolder, Provenance (ContentProvider)

label.name: Type
label.description: The type of „control“ described here. Examples are: RightsHolder, ContentProvider, ItemOwner, etc.

label.name: Temporal Scope
label.description:
Date or date-range about when this information was in order.
Date format is: "YYYY-MM-DD" (ISO8601) and can optionally contain a range, separated by a dash: "YYYY-MM-DD - YYYY-MM-DD"

label.name: Linebreak (Remarks)
label.description: This container just serves as optical linebreak.

label.name: Remarks
label.description: Any kind of noteworthy remarks.

label.name: Linebreak (Agent)
label.description: This container just serves as optical linebreak.

label.name: Agent
label.description: The agent that was known as a controlling entity for this manifestation at some point in time.

label.name: Geographic Scope
label.description: Geographic scope designates the area of influence of this particular type of controlling entity entry.

label.name: URL
label.description: An unambiguous URL reference to a related entry on one or more relevant websites. To avoid outdated URLs, using external identifiers are to be preferred over using this URL field.

label.name: Title (Item)
label.description: Titles should be given on the item level (a) if it is not known if the title found on or in the item has been used for other items of the same manifestation, (b) if no title is known or directly applicable (such as for trims, outtakes and rushes from the production of published works) and the archive has created its own descriptive 10EN 15907:2010 (E) title, or (c) if the item contains a unique combination of more than one work (e.g. a projection reel with added trailers and advertisements).

label.name: Title Text
label.description: Titles should be given on the item level (a) if it is not known if the title found on or in the item has been used for other items of the same manifestation, (b) if no title is known or directly applicable (such as for trims, outtakes and rushes from the production of published works) and the archive has created its own descriptive 10EN 15907:2010 (E) title, or (c) if the item contains a unique combination of more than one work (e.g. a projection reel with added trailers and advertisements).

label.name: Title Type
label.description: Describes the relationship between the title and the entity to which it is assigned.

label.name: Language
label.description: The language of the title. (If no value is available in the source archive, the value must be set to "undetermined".)

label.name: Holding Institution
label.description: The name of the archive or other institution possessing the copy or authorised to make it available.

label.name: Item Specifics
label.description: This element should be used for recording any major differences between the individual copy and the properties stated in the associated manifestation record. It is not intended for statements about minor degradations such as scratches. Some examples: "b/w copy of manifestation (in color)", "copy without soundtrack from sound film", "fragment, 1 500 m of 2 400 m (manifestation)", "4 of 5 reels (last reel missing)", Etc.

label.name: Access Conditions
label.description: Any information on how and to whom the item can be made available.

label.name: Creation Type (AV)
label.description: The general type of the audiovisual creation.

label.name: Verdict
label.description: The outcome of the act of rating or censorship.

label.name: Regional Scope
label.description: The country or large-scale geographic entity for which this information was/is valid.

label.name: Place
label.description: Refers to a Place entry. Using this field is preferred over the freetext option.

label.name: Freetext (Source)
label.description:
Exact quote from ValueSource.
This field is just a fallback option, in case it is not possible or desired to link to a vocabulary term. For example: To preserve information imported from 3rd party sources that cannot be mapped exactly.

label.name: Name of applicant
label.description: Name of the Agent claiming copyright in the cinematographic work.

label.name: Preservation Detail
label.description: Any information describing the process in greater detail.

label.name: Preservation Type
label.description: The general type of the preservation activity performed (e.g. "restoration", "reconstruction", "transfer", etc.).

label.name: Production Event Type
label.description: The type of event this element instance refers to. Examples are "outdoor shooting", "indoor shooting", "post-production", etc.

label.name: Has Agent details (OBSOLETE)
label.description: Replaced by vhh_HasAgent.

label.name: Activity
label.description: Defines the kind of relationship between an instance of Agent and an instance of Cinematographic Work, Variant, Manifestation, Item or Event.

label.name: Activity detail
label.description: If Activity is described using a controlled vocabulary, use this element for information that cannot be expressed in Activity (e.g. “appears only in final scene”, etc.).

label.name: Character
label.description: The name of a (fictitious or real) character played by an agent.

label.name: Name used
label.description: If the Agent is credited under a name that is not identical with the preferred name from an authority file, this element should contain the name as used in the current instance of the related entity.

label.name: Credit rank
label.description: If the ordering of credited Agents as given in particular information sources needs to be preserved, this element should be used to carry the rank number. An ordering by entry sequence alone may not be conserved by all software agents.

label.name: Activity (optional)
label.description: This is a freetext fallback alternative option to the controlled vocabulary list. Please do *NOT* use it, unless you have a very good reason to do so.

label.name: Media Technology Type
label.description: The specific sub-type (technology) is to be defined on the MANIFESTATION-level. The generic type is to be defined as MediaType on the Creation-level.

label.name: Freetext (Source)
label.description:
Exact quote from ValueSource.
This field is just a fallback option, in case it is not possible or desired to link to a vocabulary term. For example: To preserve information imported from 3rd party sources that cannot be mapped exactly.

label.name: Physical Format
label.description: The general format of the physical object (e.g. "DIN A4", "DIN A3", etc).

label.name: Size (Norm)
label.description: Which standard or norm depicting these size measurements, if there exists one.

label.name: Size (Source)
label.description:
Exact quote from ValueSource.
The dimensions of the physical object expressed in the standard format:width x height [x depth]. Preferred are millimeters, but other units are okay too.

label.name: License Type
label.description: If a copyright license is known, its type can be specified here.This field is not intended to contain detailed information about the license, just more information about its type. Examples: „CC-BY-SA“ or „Software EULA“

label.name: Type
label.description: Choosing from this list is preferred. If no entry matches, please select "Other" and write your license type information in the textfield labelled "Other".

label.name: Other
label.description: NOTE: Please only use this field if no entry in the list "type" matches.

label.name: Gender
label.description: The person's gender (male, female, unknown, etc).

label.name: Access Conditions (Event)
label.description: Specific restrictions for accessing the content of the manifestation (e.g. “for rental only”).

label.name: Certificate Number
label.description: An identifier issued by the agent uniquely identifying the act of rating or censorship and associated documents such as censorship visa or rating certificates.

label.name: Language
label.description: The language of the title. (If no value is available in the source archive, the value must be set to "undetermined".)

label.name: Name Text
label.description: A name given to the place.

label.name: Temporal Scope
label.description: For titles that were changed some time after the creation of the corresponding entity, this element should give the date when this change occurred and whether the title was introduced or withdrawn.

label.name: Name Type
label.description: Describes the relationship between the title and the entity to which it is assigned.

label.name: Temporal Scope
label.description:
The time span in which this definition was valid. Syntax for input is ISO8601:
  • Exact date: yyyy-mm-dd
  • Period: "date - date"
  • From: "date -"
  • Until: "- date"

label.name: Description
label.description: Textual descriptions of the entity. They can occur in more than one language.

label.name: Text
label.description: For (Non-)AVCreation/Manifestations, textual descriptions may include synopses, plot summaries, reviews, transcripts or shot lists.

label.name: Type
label.description: A keyword denoting the type of description.

label.name: Carrier Type
label.description: The manifestation's physical carrier. Digital manifestations may be bound to a physical carrier (e.g. "DVD") or exist without a defined carrier (e.g. "online streaming media", "podcasts").

label.name: Type
label.description: The manifestation's physical carrier. Digital manifestations may be bound to a physical carrier (e.g. "DVD") or exist without a defined carrier (e.g. "online streaming media", "podcasts").

label.name: Freetext (Source)
label.description:
Exact quote from ValueSource.
This field is just a fallback option, in case it is not possible or desired to link to a vocabulary term. For example: To preserve information imported from 3rd party sources that cannot be mapped exactly.

label.name: Credit Wording
label.description:
This field can hold a text block which can be quoted as-is for authorship/copyright/rights credits.
Although this wording may be generated automatically from other rights-related fields (like RightsStatus, LicenseType and ControllingEntity), it is mainly intended to preserve existing credit texts as-is, and also offer the fallback option in general to provide a free text for this matter.

label.name: Viewpoint
label.description: Geolocation from where an image was taken. This only applies to photos and drawings.

label.name: Rights Statement
label.description: Specifies the copyright status of the digital item.

label.name: Type
label.description: Specifies the copyright status of the digital item.

label.name: Remarks (optional)
label.description: Any additional clarifying information about the RightsStatus (optional).

label.name: Media Type
label.description: The generic type is to be defined on the CREATION-level. The specific sub-type (technology) is to be defined on the Manifestation-level.

label.name: Freetext (Source)
label.description:
Exact quote from ValueSource.
This field is just a fallback option, in case it is not possible or desired to link to a vocabulary term. For example: To preserve information imported from 3rd party sources that cannot be mapped exactly.

label.name: Type of Activity
label.description: A related main activity of the Agent taken from relationship records or from secondary sources.

label.name: Activity
label.description: A related main activity of the Agent taken from relationship records or from secondary sources. This is the preferred field to use, since it contains a controlled vocabulary.

label.name: Freetext (Source)
label.description:
Exact quote from ValueSource.
This field is just a fallback option, in case it is not possible or desired to link to a vocabulary term. For example: To preserve information imported from 3rd party sources that cannot be mapped exactly.

label.name: Temporal Scope
label.description: Time when the Agent was performing these activities.

label.name: Freetext (Source)
label.description:
Exact quote from ValueSource.
This field is just a fallback option, in case it is not possible or desired to link to a vocabulary term. For example: To preserve information imported from 3rd party sources that cannot be mapped exactly.

label.name: Freetext (Source)
label.description:
Exact quote from ValueSource.
This field is just a fallback option, in case it is not possible or desired to link to a vocabulary term. For example: To preserve information imported from 3rd party sources that cannot be mapped exactly.

label.name: Rights Note
label.description: Any remarks that relate to rights that do not fit in the other rights fields.

label.name: Title (Collection)
label.description: A textual title of the archival collection.

label.name: Language
label.description: The language of the title. (If it is not known, the value must be set to "undetermined".)

label.name: Title Text
label.description: The textual expression of the title.

label.name: Person Name
label.description: A name by which this Agent is (or was) known.

label.name: Nobiliary P.
label.description: Nobilary particle like "von" in German nobility.

label.name: Linebreak (Scope + Language)
label.description: This container just serves as optical linebreak.

label.name: Type
label.description: This attribute specifies the type of the person's name, e.g. preferred name, bureaucratic name, pseudonym, spelling variant, other name.

label.name: Temporal Scope
label.description: Time when the name was used by the Agent.

label.name: Geographic Scope
label.description: Indicates the region in which a particular name was used by the Agent.

label.name: Language
label.description: The language of the name. (If no value is available in the source archive, the value must be set to "undetermined".)

label.name: Use of Space
label.description: Information about how this place was used (bar, prison, event location, etc)

label.name: Freetext (Source)
label.description:
Exact quote from ValueSource.
This field is just a fallback option, in case it is not possible or desired to link to a vocabulary term. For example: To preserve information imported from 3rd party sources that cannot be mapped exactly.

label.name: Temporal Scope
label.description: The time span in which the place was used like this.

label.name: Group Name
label.description: A name by which the group or organization is (or was) known.

label.name: Name
label.description: A name by which this Agent is (or was) known.

label.name: Linebreak (Scope + Language)
label.description: This container just serves as optical linebreak.

label.name: Type
label.description: This attribute specifies the type of an Agent's name.

label.name: Temporal Scope
label.description: Time when the name was used by the Agent.

label.name: Geographic Scope
label.description: Indicates the region in which a particular name was used by the Agent.

label.name: Language
label.description: The language of the name. (If no value is available in the source archive, the value must be set to "undetermined".)

label.name: Description Level (Collection)
label.description: Information about on which structural level this collection is being described.

label.name: Label
label.description: A text describing the storage location.

label.name: Type
label.description: Define which type of storage location is described.

label.name: Address
label.description: A regular postal address.

label.name: Street Name
label.description: The name of the street.

label.name: Street Number
label.description: The house number on the street.

label.name: Temporal Scope
label.description: The date range when this address was valid for this place.

label.name: Award Name
label.description: The name of the award or trophy, possibly including a numeric designation (e.g. 2nd Price).

label.name: Name Text
label.description: The name of the award or trophy, possibly including a numeric designation (e.g. 2nd Price).

label.name: Achievement
label.description: A phrase describing a specific aspect for which the award was given (e.g. “best directing”, “best screenplay”, “best film”, etc.).

label.name: Type
label.description: A phrase describing a specific aspect for which the award was given (e.g. “best directing”, “best screenplay”, “best film”, etc.).

label.name: Freetext (Source)
label.description: Exact Quote from ValueSource

label.name: Publication Type (Event)
label.description: The type of an exhibition event (e.g. "Premiere", "Cinema release", "Festival screening", "Broadcast", etc.), or the type of publication (e.g. "Paperback book with DVD", etc.) if not evident from the type of the associated Manifestation.

label.name: Type
label.description: The type of an exhibition event (e.g. "Premiere", "Cinema release", "Festival screening", "Broadcast", etc.), or the type of publication (e.g. "Paperback book with DVD", etc.) if not evident from the type of the associated Manifestation.

label.name: Freetext (Source)
label.description: Exact Quote from ValueSource

label.name: Decision Type
label.description: The type or status of the decision event. Usually either "censor" for decisions mandated by law, or "rating" for decisions under a voluntary scheme. Further types may include special forms of evaluation e.g. for tax privileges (such as those from the German Filmbewertungsstelle), as long as these are distinct from awards.

label.name: Type
label.description:
The type or status of the decision event. Usually either "censor" for decisions mandated by law, or "rating" for decisions under a voluntary scheme. Further types may include special forms of evaluation
e.g. for tax privileges (such as those from the German "Filmbewertungsstelle"), as long as these are distinct from awards.

label.name: Freetext (Source)
label.description: Exact Quote from ValueSource

label.name: Event Name
label.description: The name of an event (e.g. name of a film festival, etc)

label.name: Language
label.description: The language of the title. (If it is not known, the value must be set to "undetermined".)

label.name: Name Text
label.description: The actual name of the event.

label.name: Freetext (Source)
label.description:
Exact quote from ValueSource.
This field is just a fallback option, in case it is not possible or desired to link to a vocabulary term. For example: To preserve information imported from 3rd party sources that cannot be mapped exactly.

label.name: Agent Credit (Source)
label.description: Exact quote from ValueSource

label.name: Agent Credit Detail
label.description: If credit ctivity is described using a controlled vocabulary, use this element for information that cannot be expressed in a list (e.g. “appears only in final scene”, etc.).

label.name: Agent Character
label.description: The name of a (fictitious or real) character played by an agent.

label.name: Name Used (Source)
label.description:
If the Agent is credited under a name that is not identical with the preferred name from an authority file, this element should contain the name as used in the current instance of the related entity.
Exact quote from ValueSource

label.name: Credit Rank
label.description: If the ordering of credited Agents as given in particular information sources needs to be preserved, this element should be used to carry the rank number. An ordering by entry sequence alone may not be conserved by all software agents.

label.name: Citavi Category Created?
label.description: Is this entry represented by as category in Citavi?

label.name: Wikidata Entry Created?
label.description: Has a Wikidata entry for this dataset been created by a project member?

label.name: Filmed by Allies?
label.description: Does film material of this entry exist?

label.name: Photographed by Allies?
label.description: Does photo material of this entry exist?

label.name: Reference
label.description: This field is to categorize the notes in some way.

label.description:
Exact quote from ValueSource.
This field is just a fallback option, in case it is not possible or desired to link to a vocabulary term. For example: To preserve information imported from 3rd party sources that cannot be mapped exactly.

Exact quote from ValueSource.
This field is just a fallback option, in case it is not possible or desired to link to a vocabulary term. For example: To preserve information imported from 3rd party sources that cannot be mapped exactly.

label.name: Freetext (Source)
label.description:
Exact quote from ValueSource.
This field is just a fallback option, in case it is not possible or desired to link to a vocabulary term. For example: To preserve information imported from 3rd party sources that cannot be mapped exactly.

label.name: Pixel Resolution (Display)
label.description:
The "display pixel resolution" of the media object, in difference to its "storage pixel resolution". It must not be mistaken for the resolution of the computer display (aka screen or monitor).
This information is necessary for correctly displaying an image with non-square pixel information, and usually generated on-the-fly by media applications. This field is not useful in a catalogue as the information is contained by a simple combination of pixel resolution + display aspect ratio.

role.name: Administrators
role.description: Confers actions needed by those administering the system

role.name: Cataloguers
role.description: Confers actions needed by those editing catalogue entries

role.name: Researcher
role.description: Allows users to only search and view - but not edit - catalogue entries

role.name: User content moderator
role.description: Allows users to moderate user generated tags and comments

group.name: Cataloguers
group.description: Users who can add and edit catalogue entries
